water and solute transport API

hydroroot.water_solute_transport.derivative_osmotic_p_peg(Cpeg=0.0, unit_factor=1.0, T=25.0)[source]

the 1st derivative according to X of the osmotic pressure calculation of the PEG 8000 equation 1 Michel, Plant Physiol. (1983) 72, 66-70

dpi/dw = (2 * 1.29*w*T - 2*140*w - 4.0) pi: bar w: g/g T: Celcius

Parameters

  • Cpeg – Float (Default value = 0.0)

  • unit_factor – Float (Default value = 1.0)

  • T – Float (Default value = 25.0)

Returns

  • osmotic_p: Float, the osmotic pressure (MPa)

hydroroot.water_solute_transport.derivative_viscosity_peg(Cpeg=0.0, unit_factor=1.0)[source]

Dynamic viscosity derivative according to concentration, dmu see viscosity_peg

dmu/dw = 18.4 exp(w/0.279)/0.279 dmu in mPa.s w in g/g water

Parameters

  • Cpeg – Float (Default value = 0.0)

  • unit_factor – Float (Default value = 1.0)

Returns

  • dmu: Float, the derivative

hydroroot.water_solute_transport.init_some_MTG_properties(g, tau=0.0, Cini=0.0, Cpeg_ini=0.0, t=1)[source]
initialization of some g properties specific to solute transport:

  • ‘C’: the permeating solute concentration,

  • ‘Cpeg’: the non-permeating solute concentration,

  • ‘theta’: 1 or 0 depending on the local flow direction in the xylem vessels 1 from tip to base, 0 the opposite

  • ‘J_s’: the pumping rate

Parameters

  • g – MTG

  • tau – float (Default value = 0.)

  • Cini – float (Default value = 0.)

  • Cpeg_ini – float (Default value = 0.)

  • t – int (Default value = 1)

Returns

  • g

hydroroot.water_solute_transport.osmotic_p_peg(Cpeg=0.0, unit_factor=1.0, T=25.0)[source]

osmotic pressure calculation of the PEG 8000 equation 1 Michel, Plant Physiol. (1983) 72, 66-70

pi = (1.29*w^2*T - 140*w^2 - 4.0*w) pi: bar w: g/g T: Celcius

Parameters

  • Cpeg – Float (Default value = 0.0)

  • unit_factor – Float (Default value = 1.0)

  • T – Float (Default value = 25.0)

Returns

  • osmotic_p: Float, the osmotic pressure (MPa)

hydroroot.water_solute_transport.pressure_calculation(g, Temp=298, sigma=1.0, tau=0.0, Ce=0.0, Ps=0.0, Cse=0.0, dP=None, Pe=0.4, Pbase=0.1, data=None, row=None, col=None, C_base=None)[source]

the system of equation under matrix form is solved using a Newton-Raphson schemes, at each step a system A dx = b is solved by LU decomposition.

Parameters

  • g – MTG

  • Temp – float (Default value = 298)

  • sigma – float (Default value = 1.0)

  • tau – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • Ce – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • Ps – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • Cse – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • dP – float (Default value = None)

  • Pe – float (Default value = 0.4)

  • Pbase – float (Default value = 0.1)

  • data – numpy array (Default value = None)

  • row – numpy array (Default value = None)

  • col – numpy array (Default value = None)

  • C_base – float (Default value = None)

Returns

  • g (MTG)

  • dx (array)

  • data (array)

  • row (array)

  • col (array)

This function take into account the possibility to have non-permeating solute inside the root. This is, for instance, the case when performing cut and flow experiment in a solution containing such solute. Indeed, the non-permeating solute may enter the root at cut tips. It is referred to this non-permeating solute through Cpeg when C refers to the permeating solute penetrating radially the root. The presence of Cpeg may change the sap viscosity and has influence on the osmotic pressure see beginning of the function inside the root.

hydroroot.water_solute_transport.pressure_calculation_drag(g, Temp=298, sigma=1.0, tau=0.0, Ce=0.0, Ps=0.0, Cse=0.0, dP=None, Pe=0.4, Pbase=0.1, data=None, row=None, col=None, C_base=None)[source]

Deprecated (do not work with cut and flow) As pressure_calculation() without non-permeating solutes and with a drag term in the solute transport equation.

Parameters

  • g – MTG

  • Temp – float (Default value = 298)

  • sigma – float (Default value = 1.0)

  • tau – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • Ps – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • Cse – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • dP – float (Default value = None)

  • Pe – float (Default value = 0.4)

  • Pbase – float (Default value = 0.1)

  • data – numpy array (Default value = None)

  • row – numpy array (Default value = None)

  • col – numpy array (Default value = None)

  • C_base – float (Default value = None)

  • Ce – (Default value = 0.0)

Returns

  • g (MTG)

  • dx (array)

  • data (array)

  • row (array)

  • col (array)

hydroroot.water_solute_transport.pressure_calculation_no_non_permeating_solutes(g, Temp=298, sigma=1.0, tau=0.0, Ce=0.0, Ps=0.0, Cse=0.0, dP=None, Pe=0.4, Pbase=0.1, data=None, row=None, col=None, C_base=None)[source]

As pressure_calculation() without non-permeating solutes

Parameters

  • g – MTG

  • Temp – float (Default value = 298)

  • sigma – float (Default value = 1.0)

  • tau – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • Ps – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • Cse – float (Default value = 0.0)

  • dP – float (Default value = None)

  • Pe – float (Default value = 0.4)

  • Pbase – float (Default value = 0.1)

  • data – numpy array (Default value = None)

  • row – numpy array (Default value = None)

  • col – numpy array (Default value = None)

  • C_base – float (Default value = None)

  • Ce – (Default value = 0.0)

Returns

  • g (MTG)

  • dx (array)

  • data (array)

  • row (array)

  • col (array)

hydroroot.water_solute_transport.viscosity_peg(Cpeg=0.0, unit_factor=1.0)[source]

Dynamic viscosity, mu, calculation in mPa.s according to the PEG-8000 concentration for a temperature T = 298 K Fit done on a point at Cpeg=0, mu = 1 mPa.s and the 2 fist data points (Cpeg=0.1 and 0.2) of table 2 from Gonzllez-Tello J. Chem. Eng. Data 1994,39, 611-614

mu = -17.4 + 18.4 exp(w/0.279) mu in mPa.s w in g/g water

Parameters

  • Cpeg – Float (Default value = 0.0)

  • unit_factor – Float (Default value = 1.0)

Returns

  • mu: Float, the dynamic viscosity in mPa.s

Download the source file ../../src/hydroroot/water_solute_transport.py.
